bibl.title: Letter from O. O. Howard to the Adjutant General, December 14, 1882

div1.p: Howard requests that Reed be assigned to the hospital under his command, due to his steward's disability and the limitations of the Medical Director. The Adjutant General's office denies the request. Included are an endorsement of the request and a document specifying its removal.

div1.head: Letter from O. O. Howard to the Adjutant General, December 14, 1882

COPY OF TELEGRAM SENT BY W. W. TELEGRAPH COMPANY

Headquarters Department of the Platte
1 P.M.
Omaha, Nebraska, December 14, 1882.

Adjutant General, US Army.
Washington D.C.

The age and requirement of Doctor Summers as medical
director and the disability of the steward from a severe wound
render impossible the proper performance of the
duties of attending medically the officers, enlisted men
and Government employes widely scattered in Omaha. I
ask a special exception for this place and permission
to retain here Assistant Surgeon Reed.

(Ago) O. O. Howard
Brevet Major General
Commanding
